Authors:
Emily M Walsh, Swapneel Khiste, Adam Scalera, sana sajjad,
Ning Zhang
Title:
Â Pygmaeomyceceae, a new root associated family in
Mucoromycotina from the pygmy pine plains
Keywords:
Mucoromycotina; Zygomycota; Phylogeny; Systematics;
Taxonomy; 4 new taxa
Abstract:
A new genus, Pygmaeomyces, and two new species are
described based on multi-gene phylogenetic analyses, phenotypic and
ecological characters. The species delimitation was based on concordance
of gene genealogies. The Pygmaeomyces cultures were isolated from the
roots of mountain laurel (Kalmia latifolia) and pitch pine (Pinus
rigida) from the acidic and oligotrophic New Jersey Pygmy Pine Plains
however; they probably have a broader distribution because their
internal transcribed spacer (ITS) sequences have high similarity with a
number of environmental sequences from multiple independent studies.
Based on the phylogeny and phenotypical characters, a new family
Pygmaeomyceceae is proposed to accommodate this new lineage in
Mucoromycotina. Results from this work will facilitate ecological and
evolutionary studies on root-associated fungi.
